RIPPLE.name: Ripple
RIPPLE.tagline: Enterprise blockchain company powering instant, low-cost global payments through RippleNet and the XRP Ledger
RIPPLE.overview: Ripple Labs, Inc. is an American technology company founded in 2012 that focuses on blockchain-based payment solutions for financial institutions. The company develops RippleNet, a global payments network, and maintains the XRP Ledger, an open-source blockchain. After a landmark SEC lawsuit that concluded in August 2025 with a $50 million settlement (reduced from $125M), Ripple raised $500 million in November 2025 at a $40 billion valuation—its first major fundraising in six years. The company initiated a $700 million share buyback in June 2025 at $25 billion implied valuation. Ripple launched the RLUSD stablecoin in December 2024, which exceeded $1 billion market cap by November 2025. Multiple spot XRP ETFs have been approved following the SEC settlement.

products.name: RippleNet
products.description: Global payments network connecting banks and payment providers for instant cross-border transactions

products.name: XRP Ledger
products.description: Open-source, decentralized blockchain for fast, low-cost transactions

products.name: RLUSD Stablecoin
products.description: USD-backed stablecoin launched Dec 2024, now $1B+ market cap

products.name: On-Demand Liquidity (ODL)
products.description: Real-time cross-border payments using XRP as a bridge currency

products.name: Ripple Custody
products.description: Enterprise-grade digital asset custody solution for institutions

products.name: Ripple Prime
products.description: Prime brokerage service from Hidden Road acquisition ($1.25B)

products.name: Liquidity Hub
products.description: Enterprise liquidity management for digital assets

highlights.text: Raised $500M at $40B valuation led by Fortress and Citadel Securities (Nov 2025)
SEC lawsuit concluded August 2025 with $50M settlement—case closed after 5 years
RLUSD stablecoin exceeded $1B market cap by November 2025
CEO testified at Senate Banking Committee hearing on digital assets (Jul 2025)
Court ruled XRP is not a security in retail transactions
Acquired Hidden Road for $1.25B (Ripple Prime) and Rail for $200M
Multiple spot XRP ETFs approved following SEC settlement

funding_rounds.investors_html: Fortress, Citadel Securities, Pantera, Galaxy Digital
Tetragon, SBI Holdings, Route 66 Ventures

RIPPLING.name: Rippling
RIPPLING.tagline: Unifying HR, IT, and finance in one platform to manage the complete employee lifecycle
RIPPLING.overview: Rippling is a unified workforce management platform founded in 2016 by Parker Conrad (former Zenefits CEO). The company provides HR, IT, and finance tools in a single platform, managing everything from onboarding to payroll to device management. In May 2025, Rippling raised $450M at $16.8B valuation (up from $13.5B in April 2024), with $200M allocated for employee share buybacks. Revenue is growing 30%+ annually with $350M+ ARR. Conrad's net worth reached $2.3B. Y Combinator is among Rippling's customers.

products.name: Rippling IT Cloud
products.description: Device management, app provisioning, and security

products.name: Rippling Finance Cloud
products.description: Corporate cards, expense management, and bill pay

funding_rounds.investors_html: Elad Gil, Sands Capital, GIC, Goldman Sachs, Baillie Gifford, YC

REMOTE.name: Remote
REMOTE.tagline: Enabling companies to hire, pay, and manage distributed teams across borders with employer of record services
REMOTE.overview: Remote is a global employment platform founded in 2019 by Job van der Voort and Marcelo Lebre. The company provides Employer of Record (EOR), global payroll, and contractor management services across 170+ countries. Remote raised $300M at $3B valuation in 2022 led by SoftBank Vision Fund 2. The company grew from 50 to 1,800 employees and operates fully remotely. In 2025, Remote launched Remote Recruit (AI-powered talent sourcing with 800M+ candidates) and expanded AI-driven payroll to 100+ countries.

products.name: Remote HR Management
products.description: Unified HR platform for global teams

highlights.text: Partnership with Gusto for US SMB global hiring

highlights.title: TechCrunch: Remote Recruit Launch
highlights.description: Remote launches AI-powered talent sourcing with 800M+ candidate database

highlights.title: TechCrunch: Remote Global Benefits
highlights.description: Remote partners with Kota to launch global benefits solution for distributed teams

RETOOL.name: Retool
RETOOL.tagline: Empowering developers to build custom internal tools rapidly using visual components and code
RETOOL.overview: Retool is a low-code platform for building internal tools, founded in 2017 by David Hsu (YC alum). The platform allows developers to build custom internal applications 10x faster using drag-and-drop components connected to any database or API. Retool raised $45M Series C2 at $3.2B valuation in 2022, with investors including Sequoia Capital and Stripe founders John and Patrick Collison. ARR reached $120M in October 2025, up from $90M in 2024. Enterprise customers include Amazon, Mercedes-Benz, Progressive, Peloton, and Rakuten. Recent AI launches (AppGen, Agents) introduced new monetization.

products.name: Retool Apps
products.description: Drag-and-drop builder for internal web applications

products.name: Retool Mobile
products.description: Build native mobile apps for internal use cases

products.name: Retool AI
products.description: AI-powered app generation and agents (AppGen, Agents)

products.name: Retool Database
products.description: Built-in PostgreSQL database for internal apps

highlights.text: $120M ARR reached October 2025, up from $90M in 2024
AppGen and Agents AI features launched for automated app generation (2025)

RAMP.name: Ramp
RAMP.tagline: AI-powered financial operations platform transforming corporate spend management and saving businesses time and money
RAMP.overview: Ramp is a leading financial operations platform founded in March 2019 by Eric Glyman, Karim Atiyeh, and Gene Lee. Headquartered in New York City, Ramp has revolutionized corporate spend management through its AI-powered platform that combines corporate cards, expense management, bill payments, procurement, and automated bookkeeping. The company's mission is to help businesses save time and money by automating financial operations and providing intelligent insights. As of November 2025, Ramp has achieved a valuation of $32 billion following a $300 million funding round, marking a remarkable 146% increase from its July 2025 valuation of $22.5 billion. With over 50,000 customers and processing more than $100 billion in annual purchases, Ramp has become one of the fastest-growing fintechs in the United States, challenging incumbents like American Express and SAP Concur.

highlights.text: Ramp continues to grow and expand

investors.name: Corporate Cards: Up to 1.5% cashback with intelligent spend controls and no fees.

RELIANCE-JIO.name: Reliance Jio
RELIANCE-JIO.tagline: India's largest telecom operator powering digital transformation with 5G, fiber, and digital services
RELIANCE-JIO.overview: Reliance Jio Infocomm Limited is India's largest mobile network operator and the third-largest globally with over 506 million subscribers. A subsidiary of Reliance Industries, Jio revolutionized India's digital landscape by launching with free 4G services in 2016, sparking a data consumption revolution. Today, Jio operates the world's largest 5G network outside China with 170 million 5G subscribers, and offers integrated digital services spanning connectivity, entertainment, payments, and enterprise solutions across 190+ countries.

products.name: Jio 5G
products.description: Ultra-fast 5G network covering major Indian cities with True 5G standalone architecture

products.description: High-speed fiber-to-the-home broadband with speeds up to 1 Gbps

products.description: Streaming platform with 800+ live TV channels and OTT content

products.description: E-commerce platform integrated with WhatsApp for grocery and retail

products.description: Cloud storage and enterprise cloud computing services

highlights.description: Jio adds 22 million 5G subscribers in Q3 FY25 alone, net profit surges 26% YoY

RELIANCE-RETAIL.name: Reliance Retail
RELIANCE-RETAIL.tagline: India's largest, fastest-growing and most profitable retailer with 19,340+ stores across 7,000+ towns, serving 349M+ customers
RELIANCE-RETAIL.overview: Reliance Retail Ventures Limited is India's largest and most profitable retailer, a subsidiary of Reliance Industries Limited. Founded in 2006, the company operates across consumer electronics (Reliance Digital), fashion (AJIO, Trends), grocery (JioMart, Smart Bazaar, Freshpik, 7-Eleven), beauty (Tira), toys (Hamleys), and specialty formats. In FY25, Reliance Retail posted revenues of ₹3.31 lakh crore ($38.7B), up 8% YoY, with EBITDA of ₹25,094 crore ($2.9B). With 19,340+ stores spanning 7,000+ towns and a registered customer base of 349 million, Reliance Retail is ranked 40th in Deloitte's Global Powers of Retailing—the only Indian retailer in the Top 100. JP Morgan valued the company at $143 billion in September 2024. The company has raised $9.8B from global investors including Silver Lake, KKR, General Atlantic, Qatar Investment Authority, and Saudi Arabia's PIF.

highlights.text: Reliance Retail continues to grow and expand

REPLIT.name: Replit
REPLIT.tagline: AI-powered platform enabling anyone to build software through natural language
REPLIT.overview: Replit is an AI-powered software creation platform founded in 2016 by Amjad Masad, Haya Odeh, and Faris Masad. It revolutionizes software development by enabling anyone to build applications using natural language through its flagship Replit Agent. As of September 2025, Replit has achieved a $3 billion valuation following its $250 million funding round. The company serves over 30 million users globally and generates $150 million in annual recurring revenue, having grown 10x from $10M to $100M ARR in just 5.5 months between late 2024 and mid-2025.

highlights.text: Replit continues to grow and expand

REVOLUT.name: Revolut
REVOLUT.tagline: Global fintech leader providing digital banking, payments, and financial services to 65M+ customers worldwide
REVOLUT.overview: Revolut is a global financial technology company founded in July 2015 by Nikolay Storonsky and Vlad Yatsenko in London. The company started as a digital-first alternative to traditional banking, initially offering a prepaid card and multi-currency exchange at interbank rates. Today, Revolut has evolved into a comprehensive financial super-app serving over 65 million customers across 48+ countries. As of November 2025, the company achieved a valuation of $75 billion, making it Europe's most valuable private technology company. Revolut offers a full suite of banking services including multi-currency accounts supporting 120+ currencies, debit and credit cards, stock trading, cryptocurrency exchange, insurance, peer-to-peer payments, and business banking solutions. The company reported remarkable financial performance in 2024 with $4 billion in revenue (up 72% year-over-year) and $1.4 billion in profit before tax (up 149%). With banking licenses secured in multiple jurisdictions including the UK, EU, Mexico, Colombia, and India, Revolut is pursuing its ambitious vision to become the world's first truly global bank serving 100 million customers across 100 countries by 2027.

investors.name: Digital Banking: Multi-currency accounts, debit/credit cards in 48+ countries
